reasoning: The cooking steps were extracted by identifying the key actions and instructions provided by Jacques Pepin for preparing gravlax. Each step is a continuation of the process, starting from slicing the salmon to serving it with garnishes and accompaniments.
dish_description: Gravlax is a dish of cured salmon, traditionally doused with salt, sugar, and dill, and served with accompaniments like capers, onions, and a side of bread.

cooking_steps.description: Cut the salmon into thin slices, aiming for an ounce and a half to two ounces per person.
Generously salt the salmon slices on both sides and add pepper to taste.
If preparing for a party or larger group, portion out the salmon slices ahead of time.
Cover the portioned salmon slices with plastic wrap and stack the plates.
Refrigerate the prepared salmon for 2-3 hours or even a day ahead.
When ready to serve, garnish the salmon with capers, mild onions like Vidalia, radishes, cucumbers, scallion greens, and shredded basil or other fresh herbs from the garden.
Drizzle olive oil around the plated salmon.
Serve the gravlax with black bread or a crunchy baguette, and provide lemon or lime on the side, cut off-center to avoid seeds.
